issues.description: The commented example in the templateâ€™s Main.java uses two-argument constructors for Seal, Pig, and Goat (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")), but the exercise specification (UML and text) and the solution only define single-argument constructors initializing the `name`. This mismatch will confuse students about how many parameters their constructors should take.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the commented instantiations in template/Main.java to use single-argument constructors (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle")) or, if two parameters are intended, add a matching second attribute and constructor parameter to the Seal, Pig, and Goat classes accordingly.
